title: BlackhatEspeed
author: BlackhatEspeed
content: Hello,how is everyone on bitcointalk doing?I'm currently working on a peer to peer crypto exchange with some partners, looking for some full time traders, we can assist with private equity, to complete private regulated KYC transactions through a licensed MSB.If you are interested please begin the registration process on our website and open a ticket / contact with us if you are interested.https://1337mushroom.exchange/We have a referral and trading shares through automated direct BTC payment. All fees are 1%.Thank you for your interest.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: 1. Remembering this kind of domain name is cumbersome. It also increases chances of users becoming targets of phishing attacks. Please look for a better domain name.2. the feedback on your website is obviously fake3. under payment methods. Add an option to select all payment methods at ago.

comments.author: BlackhatEspeed
comments.body: Thank you for the recommendations, will update the modifications. If you see anything else let me know thanks. I would like some help testing the escrow system im currently working on the code for the custody

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: Quote from: BlackhatEspeed on September 20, 2023, 08:00:13 PMI would like some help testing the escrow system im currently working on the code for the custodyHow are you going to do this?Are you going to set up a small beta testing campaign where you will give the test some small amounts of BTC to test the platform because as far as I know, very many members here are paranoid, especially when the platform is still new and wouldn't want to risk their very own funds to test it out.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: By "to complete private regulated KYC transactions", do you mean beta testers have to KYC first? if so, that's a bit too much. Frankly, I don't understand why if the the funds will be from the exchange team or they'll use testnet coins.Could you also elaborate why you specifically need "full-time traders"?

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: BlackhatEspeed on September 20, 2023, 08:00:13 PMThank you for the recommendations, will update the modifications. If you see anything else let me know thanks. I would like some help testing the escrow system im currently working on the code for the custodyWithout running a review campaign, you will not get anything, and if it is mandatory to complete KYC verification, I think the number of people who would be willing to do that here is very small. In general, if KYC were not mandatory, running a campaign for about $2,000 would be enough ($100 per review and about 20 reviews)You need a more professional domain name and an expert advertising team, as the competition in this field is intense, and even services such as LBC and Paxful failed to win this competition.Quote from: Potato Chips on September 21, 2023, 10:35:43 AMCould you also elaborate why you specifically need "full-time traders"?I think he is looking for people who have enough experience or consider trading a full-time job.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Aside from all of the suggestions given about the domain and running a beta testing campaign. You need to update all of your reviews. It doesn't look real and I know that it's just like a template but with little details being seen by your potential traders, it could be a turn off for them.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on September 21, 2023, 01:04:13 PMI think he is looking for people who have enough experience or consider trading a full-time job.Oh okay, that's fair. If that's the case, it's likely non full timers with enough experience could do the job as well provided that they have the spare time.My guess is, most people on the community aren't full time traders given how unstable the income can be hence the above relaxed requirement should open up more candidates.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on September 21, 2023, 11:50:20 PMQuote from: hugeblack on September 21, 2023, 01:04:13 PMI think he is looking for people who have enough experience or consider trading a full-time job.Oh okay, that's fair. If that's the case, it's likely non full timers with enough experience could do the job as well provided that they have the spare time.My guess is, most people on the community aren't full time traders given how unstable the income can be hence the above relaxed requirement should open up more candidates.he tries to attract traders from platforms like LBC/Paxful/BinanceP2P, perhaps in exchange for giving them cheaper fees, referral links, or other ways to attract a client base. The problem is that identity verification must be completed, so services like BinanceP2P are still better, or decentralized services like Bisq therefore he needs a specialized team to carry out a good advertising campaign after review campaign.I looked into his account and he has other projects in the past. I don't know if he is the main developer or not, but was hoping it was non-KYC service.

comments.author: BlackhatEspeed
comments.body: Hello thank you for your supportive words, I really appreciate your feedback.https://docs.sleep.finance/team-backgoundSleep Finance Seamless Test Net, you were correct we were thinking in the same direction, that’s exactly what sleep is, onboarding and liquidity services, still patching up security and roll out, contact me for anything.

comments.author: BitcoinsGreat
comments.body: Quote from: BlackhatEspeed on October 01, 2023, 06:33:05 AMHello thank you for your supportive words, I really appreciate your feedback.https://docs.sleep.finance/team-backgoundSleep Finance Seamless Test Net, you were correct we were thinking in the same direction, that’s exactly what sleep is, onboarding and liquidity services, still patching up security and roll out, contact me for anything.I see the team in that above link have 5-15+ years of experience (can't be verified though) but that does not mean that the project becomes trustworthy. If you are really serious on getting the userbase on your site and have real feedback for improvement, you need to think about the options mentioned by hugeblack and others.Quote from: hugeblack on September 21, 2023, 01:04:13 PMWithout running a review campaign, you will not get anything, and if it is mandatory to complete KYC verification, I think the number of people who would be willing to do that here is very small. In general, if KYC were not mandatory, running a campaign for about $2,000 would be enough ($100 per review and about 20 reviews)Also, for the forum members and the testing of your site, you can lift the KYC requirements for those who participate in the review campaign (in case you decide to run one).

comments.author: BlackhatEspeed
comments.body: Thank you for your feedback, also thank you for everyone from this site especially who sent me recommendations im trying to implement every suggestion. https://1337mushroom.com/
